Key Arguments: No single body should determine what is false or harmful due to potential bias or ideological capture.
Free speech is essential for democracy, even if it allows malicious lies.
The legislation could lead to suppression of information and government censorship.
The bill could force social media companies to err on the side of caution, limiting free speech.
The exception for legacy media suggests bias and unfair application of the law.
Main Themes: Potential for government overreach and censorship
Notable Quotes: Free speech, even at the cost of allowing malicious lies to be told, is essential to the function of democracy.
The public square of social media, for all its chaos and conflict, is the place where people need to be allowed to say anything that is permitted by law.
This bill heads in exactly the wrong direction.
